dir-section.heading: Banking
dir-section.p: At July 2022 there were 20 authorized credit institutions and one savings banks operating in Croatia.

org-entry.content-note: in 1990 assumed the responsibilities of a central bank empowered as the republic’s bank of issue

org-entry.found-date: 1996 as Hypo Bank Croatia d.d.; name changed as Hypo Alpe-Adria-Bank d.d. in 1999
org-entry.content-note: re-established as Addiko Bank in 2016
owned by Addiko Bank AG (Austria)
fmrly Kreditna Banka Zagreb; renamed in 2019
19.9% owned by Agram Životno Osiguranje, 20.0% owned by Euroherc Osiguranje, 20.0% owned by Jadransko Osiguranje, 13.2% owned by Podravska Banka, 11.2% owned by Primorska Banka
state-owned

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Croatian Bank for Reconstruction and Development
org-entry-head.alt-name: Hrvatska Banka za Obnovu i Razvoj

org-entry.content-note: name changed in 1995
state-owned

org-entry.found-date: 2000 by merger of Bjelovarska Banka, Cakoveka Banka and Trgovačka Banka
org-entry.content-note: 59% owned by Erste Group Bank AG (Austria), 41% owned by Steiermärkische Bank und Sparkassen AG (Austria)
44.9% state-owned, 11.9% Croatian Post, 8.7% Croatian Pension Insurance Institute, 8.9% owned by Croatian Agency for Deposit Insurance and Bank Rehabilitation
commercial and joint-stock bank
fmrly Sberbank Hrvatska; renamed as above in 2022, following acquisition by Hrvatska Poštanska Banka (HPB) group
present name adopted in 2005, following acquisition by OTP Bank (Hungary) in 2005
absorbed Banco Popolare Croatia in 2014
acquired Splitska Bank in 2018
commercial bank
97.5% owned by Intesa Sanpaolo Holding International SA (Luxembourg)
owned by Raiffeisen SEE Region Holding GmbH (Austria)
84.5% owned by UniCredit S.p.A. (Italy), 11.7% by Allianz SE (Germany)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Hrvatska Agencija za Nadzor Financijskih Usluga

org-entry.content-note: fmrly Jadransko Osiguranje; renamed as above in 2018
12.5% owned by Euroherc Osiguranje d.d., 9.9% owned by Jadransko Osiguranje d.d.
life insurance, annuity, property, motor vehicle and transport insurance, personal accident insurance, health insurance, liability insurance
62.3% owned by Adris grupa d.d. (Adris Gp)
30.6% state-owned
owned by Grazer Wechselseitige Versicherung AG (Austria)
owned by Merkur International Holding AG (Austria)
owned by Triglav Insurance Co (Slovenia)
fully owned by UNIQA International AG
acquired Basler Osiguranje Zagreb in 2014

org-entry.found-date: 2013 by merger of Helios VIG and Kvarner Vienna Insurance Group
org-entry.content-note: acquired Erste Osiguranje Vienna Insurance Gp d.d. in 2018
